title: Error when running train_network on supercomputing (Setting environment variables on devices without monitors)
body:
Windows 10 

Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using.
Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x.


I uploaded the data to supercomputing system to run the training steps in there but when the job starts it fails immediately giving the following error:

  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/icm/hydra/home/grid/plgmirandeitor/.pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py", line 25, in <module>
    from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
  File "/icm/hydra/home/grid/plgmirandeitor/.pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/__init__.py", line 15, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.auxfun_drag_label import *
  File "/icm/hydra/home/grid/plgmirandeitor/.pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/auxfun_drag_label.py", line 18, in <module>
    import wx
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'wx'

The call i do using the bash file is:

deeplabcut.train_network('/icm/hydra/home/plgmirandeitor/upload to ICM/Interaction_Test2/Interaction Test-David-2019-01-24/config.yaml',shuffle=1)

I thought that the wx library is for graphic representation, so i don't know why is being called at this step. Is there any step I'm missing to run things on the server?
